content.description: Start on a jug about chest high. Move left to a pocket and a smaller jug. Reach high and go straight up just to the left of the prow.
content.location:
To the right of

Geo Thermal

(maybe 8 feet).

content.description: Start on a jug sidepull. Move up to a pocket and then pull on small crimps up the right side of the prow.
content.location:
Starts to the right of

Geo Thermal

(maybe 8 feet).

content.description:
Super Sloper moves past some very cool holds to a nice easy climb-off. From a foot-long sloping ramp low, and near the east end of

Green Energy

, pull straight up with the right hand to a gnarly sloping hold on the lip of the bulge, bring up the left to an arete squeeze about 1-foot left of the R hand. Bring the feet, then pop the right hand to a 3"-wide 1st pad ledge up and right of the right hand. Viola.
content.location:
The start is off of the second hold along the

Green Energy Traverse

.

content.description: A right to left traverse along the wall directly behind and slightly west of the pine tree that grows sideways out of the base of the wall. There are several "up" sequences here as well. Locate the large starting holds on the right end of the wall, and go left using the bottom set of sloping holds until you are just right of the broken corner, then straight up until you can step off onto the top of the same broken corner.
content.location: This traverse is not on the Mezz., but on a wall just east. Locate the horizontal pine tree (see photo) and you have found it!

content.description:
Sleestack is a left to right traverse that begins on the lowest part of the sloping rail near the left end of the Mezzanine. Start as far left as you can, reverse the crux of

Green Energy

, and finish up the arete of

Diesel

.
Green Energy is immediately obvious as you walk onto the tier up from a large Juniper tree. The line crosses an overhanging wall from right to left, and requires attention to body tension.
content.location: Start in a scoop about 3' off the ground under a bulging overhang. Move across the wall ( R-to-L ) without deviating from the starting level/line of holds. Several long reaches move past a sloping ramp to finish up and left of a boulder that forms the west end of the alcove. There are a few "straight-up" problems that start at various points along the traverse, and it is quite easy to spend the majority of a session in the area.

content.description: An independant line from a sit start on a pair of small crimps way down low. Fire up with the R hand to a small sloping finger bucket located up and right of the start. Bring the L hand up to the sloping lip of the overhang, match, and power up the remaining slab, using only holds on the slab, to a nice finishing ledge at 10-12'.
content.location:
Located just left of the middle of

Green Energy

.

content.description:
A right to left problem that starts 8' right of

Cold Fusion

, and traverses slopers, an unlikely gaston, to the arete hold at the top of

Cold Fusion

.
content.location:
Past

Green Energy

45' in an alcove under a large roof.

content.description:
This is a Crimp-o-rama that begins on

Green Energy

, and goes up at the slot to a pair of stacked bBad holds consisting of a very small crimp, and a 1st pad 3-finger sloper. Use these holds to surmount the slab to the left, and crank up to easier ground.

Diesel is a really cool find next to the start of

Green Energy

. Locate a nice four-finger hueco down low for your left hand, and an undercling/sidepull jug for the right. Follow the jugs up to a rail, set the left hand on the arete hold, and go all the way up with the right hand to the diagonal hold that runs to the top of the arete. Climb straight up to a mantle at 14', or climb off to the right once the top is gained.
content.location: Locate the large sidepull jugs that ascend the rock in a curving line. There is a large hueco near the ground for a great starting hold.

content.description:
From the Tier where

Green Energy

is located, continue west about 45-50 feet. Cold Fusion starts under a bulging wall with a sit start. The starting holds are very small and can be found on a rounded feature just above the ground. Pop up and right to a vertical feature that is about 16" long. Next go up and left with the left hand to a crimp/arete hold about 40" above/left of the right hand. Pop the right up a little, then go left up to a sharp crimp also on the left arete.  Cross through underneath with the right hand to a small crimp up and left of the left hand, and traverse off.
content.location:
This is 45-50' west of

Green Energy Traverse

.

content.description:
Atomic begins at the sit start in the middle of

Green Energy

. Throw a ridiculously long left hand up to the sloping shelf (left of

Green Energy

incut hold ), Bring the right hand up to the shelf, then find the left hand undercling (see photo). Power the right hand up to a nice flat edge on the south-east face above, and go left hand to the apex of the roof.
content.location: Start at the sit jugs, and go up and left.

content.description: This is a nice piece for a youngster to climb. at least 3-different ways up, with nice finishing holds for the young and the gripped!
content.location: This is on the same level as the sloper traverse wall, and the west end before you are forced to step up a level to the Mezzanine.

content.description: Short but fun. Start on a jug. Move up to two small, painful crimps. Set your feet and make a big reach to another crimp and pull.
content.location: To the right side of The Mezzanine.
